strings.Value: [Begin the surgery] "Let's begin."
[Leave] "Give me a few moments to look around."
"Who's our patient?"
"Why the prison? Was there no place more suitable?"
"Where are all the prison inmates?"
"What have you already tried?"
"Where will the surgery take place?"
"Good. I've no need for a torture chamber anyway."
"Well, isn't that ironic?"
"A shame. I could make use of a torture chamber."

"This is our hospital." {n}Jhod shows you around the bleak, comfortless building with its barred cells.{/n} "The prison is certainly not the best location, nor the healthiest. But it's better than nothing. Also... It might be cruel to say this — but, considering the nature of the malady, it would be safer for everyone if the patients were kept behind the bars until they are healed!"
"Her name is Madla Stasek. A peasant woman from a nearby village. We hadn't seen any prior cases of the disease there..."

"Standard spells to heal disease, remove poison, and lift curses — all ineffective. Attempting to dispel the magic is also fruitless. I fear we may be dealing with a curse of strength enough to surpass our own faith..."

"There were naught but a few pickpockets locked away here. We put them to work cleaning the place up, then set them free. There is one still here, though. He wasn't some petty thief, but a seasoned highwayman."
"If only the city had a clinic..."
"Well, that room was previously a... torture chamber. There was already a suitable table..."
"I thought as much!"
"This is no laughing matter!"
{n}The cleric frowns but remains silent.{/n}
"If you must, but please, don't take too long!"
"Are you ready? Please, we cannot delay much longer!"
{n}Jhod breathes in deeply, then exhales slowly.{/n} "{g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} be with us..."
"I hope the city will get a proper clinic, in time."
"It isn't a matter of faith. I don't think it's a disease, let alone some powerful curse. I suspect it's some sort of parasite, hiding itself within the body."
"Nonsense! We've detected magic suffusing each patient's body, evenly distributed! If it was some sort of parasite, it would be a simple matter to detect!"

"Then it's able to disguise itself! Maybe it's poisoning their blood with its magic — by the Sun, we return to this argument over and over. It's been days! Let's stop talking and try doing something already!"

"Even if it did, the prison would still be the best choice. Don't forget, at any moment one of the patients could... You know — die and release a monster. It's safer for everyone if we keep them locked up."
"I pray for that brave woman. She's the first one to mount the courage necessary to volunteer for the surgery. We cannot let her down."
"Sarenrae help us."
